Name: À vous de jouer
Description: French cycling themed game that was published for ProTour team Caisse d'épargne. In this game that is played on the beach the players first draw a track in the sand. Then they use a sort of marble that is flicked in a similar way as the famous Carabande game. The marble determines the positing of the cyclists (pawns). He who reaches the finish first wins.

Name: Financial City
Description:
Financial City is a game made up to increase your knowladge in areas such as the Stock Market, Real Estate, Business. By playing the game, you will experience different situations from real life and you will increase your decision making skills related to income increase. Financial City is for players 14 and up and can be played by up to 8 players. Every player will receive an expenses keeping file. Every player will pick a card from the Jobs category. On each of the cards one will find the profession (specialty), the salary and the monthly expenses. At the beginning of the game every player will receive a sum of money equal to the double of the salary.

From the publishers' website.

Name: Flume (hex hex)
Description:
Hex hex Flume is a very simple game for two players, played on a hex hex board lined with a perimeter of green stones (or green, stone-sized stickers).   Two players, Red and Blue, take turns adding stones of their own color to the board.

If you add a stone which forms 5 or 6 connections (adjacencies) with neighboring stones of any color (red, blue or green) you must add another stone to the board while it's still your turn. And so on. Your turn concludes when you add a stone which forms 4 or less connections with neighboring stones.

Certain move types are prohibited in hex hex Flume, unlike its sister game, square Flume, in which there are no prohibited move types.

The object is to have the majority of stones on the board.

Name: Californiaopoly
Description: California Monopoly with an extremely colorful game board.  Includes: Deck of Fate Cards, Deck of Property Cards, 6 Playing Pieces, 15 Skyscrapers, 15 Redding Bungalows, 15 Eureka Bungalows, 2 Dice & Play Money.

Name: Plumb Crazy
Description:
Simple spin and move game with a cool 3D spinner.

Contents:

BIG 15 X 15 Game Board
4 Friendly Plumber Game Pieces
Swing Around Spinner

Name: Battle Royale II
Description:
Card game base on the move Battle Royale II. It follows Battle Royal.
Players are students and try to kill each other. The last one standing wins the game.

There are terrorist cards placed in the middle of the board. Players have a team of student-cards. Each team tries with different weapon cards to destroy their opponents or the terrorists. The weapon cards are held in the hand. A player which loses all of his/her student-cards loses the game.

Name: Skull
Description:
Post apocalyptic football game. 
Based on the movie 'The Blood of Heroes'.

The aim of the game is to get a 'dogskull' onto a spike at the opposing end of the field while preventing the opposing team from doing the same.

The team of each player may choose between:
 Runner: The only piece allowed to touch the skull and score points. (mandatory)
Chain: The piece with the greatest reach on the field and strong damage.
Pole: Fighting piece able to block front field spaces.
Net: Catch enemy pieces
Hook: Pin enemy pieces

Cards are used for movement and to determine the outcome of fights.

The game comes in a video cassette box, with board, tokens and cards.

Name: Go Goal! Ole! Tournament
Description:
In Go Goal! Ole! Tournament each player contols a team of five footballers.  On their turn each players can spend up to one action for each footballer they control, not including the goalkeeper.

That action may be to move the footballer 1 space in any direction, to tackle another player, to pass the ball to another footballer or empty space, play an SFC (Special Function Card) or shoot for goal.

To tackle, each player rolls a D12.  If the attacker wins, the two footballers exchange places and the attacker gains possession of the ball.

To pass the ball to another player or space, you just need to have line of sight to the space you're aiming for and it needs to be in a straight line (like the queen's movement in chess).  You then simply place the ball on that player or space.

Each player recieves 3 Special Funcion Cards in each half of the game which can be played at any point during your turn.

To shoot at goal, each footballer figure has a spring-loaded knee joint which you pull back and release.  This is where the dexterity aspect of the game comes in.

There are 90 of these super-quick turns in a standard game, and whoever has scored the most goals by the end is the winner.

From the description on the box:
Go Goal! Ole! Tournament is a five-a-side football board game, combining the technique of shooting a ball and strategic thinking of a board game that gives players to enjoy and feel the excitement of a real football match.

Contents:
1x Football Field
4x Footballs
8x Footballer Figures with Stands
2x Goalkeeper Figures with Stands
2x Goal Posts with 4x Goal Screws
1x Score and Round Counter
25x Special Function Cards
4x Promotion Stands
1x Coin
2x 12-sided Dice
4x Stoppage Cones
1x VCD/DVD Game Demo
1x Full-Colour Manual (in English)
4x Black & White Manuals (Danmark, Norge, Suomi & Sverige)

The official website is:
www.gogoalole.com

Name: Too Bad!
Description:
Description from BoardgameNews.com:

Too Bad! is a perfect information game in which players want to be the first to bring all their dice home. Each player has dice that start with the face-up numbers 1-4, with the 4s in the starting spot farthest from home, the 3s in the next starting spot, and so on.

On a turn, a player moves one of her dice as many spaces as the sum of all the dice sharing the same space. Land on a "slip & flip" slide, and you knock off any dice in the middle of the slide, while flipping your die upside-down at the end of the ride. Thus, a 4 becomes a 3, a 3 becomes a 2, and so on.

Name: Prophecy: The Card Game
Description:
Publisher's website

The goal is to find prophecies and their matching fulfillments for six famous Prophets. When a match is made it scores a point for the player who made the prophecy. The first player to make three prophecies is the winner! Throughout the course of the game, Trials and Tribulations stir up trouble. Angels and Guardians may be able to help protect your Prophets from time to time, and Divine Interventions can help you as well.

Name: Drugo: the ultimate drug education game
Description:
Each player has a card (similar to bingo) with drug "lifestyle" references
in each space, such as Cocaine, Police department, Illegal, Sedative, etc.
The caller has a stack of cards which he turns over one at a time and reads
the statement on it.  Then players must determine what the proper response or
definition is, and place a token on that space. 
A winner is determined when a card ihas every spot filled, and checked to be legal.
A variation for scoring is similar to bingo, with many variations, such as 4 corners,
5 in a row, 5 in a diagonal being a winner.  There is also a master sheet
which the caller places the cards on when called, so that later when checking
a card, the person can figure out if they got a question wrong.

40 playing cards, 75 calling clues, Drugo Fact Sheet, Directions, 
Checking Master Chart, Instruction sheet, and whole lot of pink 
markers.

Name: Disney Princess Ready, Dress, Go!
Description:
From the publisher:

Cinderella, Ariel, Snow White, Aurora and Belle are racing to get ready and get to the Ball! Each Princess needs her invitation, her flowers, her crown, her dress and her shoes before she can go to the castle to meet her handsome Prince...

Players use a colored spinner to move their Princess along a colored path where some squares indicate one of the items the players are collecting. Items are represented by puzzle pieces that, when collected and assemble, form a picture of each of the 5 Disney Princesses in the game. When a player has collected all 5 items for their Princess and have reached the end of the path, they can meet up with their prince by getting the correct color on the spinner.

Name: Coeur de Lion
Description: Wargaming rules for the Crusades era, 1000-1300 A.D.  Ground scale is 1 inch = 10 yards.  Figure scale is 1 figure = 20 men.  Time scale is 1 turn = 15 minutes time. 28 pages.

Name: Questions pour un Champion
Description:
Questions pour un Champion is a French game based on the TV show of the same name. Played from 3 to 5 players it is a game that tests both your knowledge and your reflex.

In the first round all the players are obliged to answer questions by pushing a special button before anyone else does. The goal is to score 9 points which takes a player to the second round. The player that didn't reach 9 points when everyone else did is eliminated.

In the second round each remaining player chooses one of four proposed subjects and has to answer questions related to it. The maximum score here is 4 points (for 4 consecutive correct answers). The best two players go through to the final.

In the last round the two remaining players are face to face, having to find the answer for some long questions read by the presenter. The players may score 4, 3, 2 or 1 point, based on the number of information given by the presenter. The first player to score 9 points is the winner.

Name: ASL: Journal – Issue Eight
Description:
(from MMP's website :)

The ASL Journal #8 is a 60-page magazine of nothing but articles, scenarios, and support materials for Advanced Squad Leader.

The Table of Contents for ASL Journal #8 looks like this:


     Carl Nogueira shows you the proper way to grease the treads of your tank in Crosstown Traffic — a detailed look at the rules for Vehicular Overrun.
     Mark Pitcavage teaches new ASL players how to lose some of that new player shine in The Agony of Defeat.
     Lars Thuring and Tuomo Lukkari take us on a tour of the upcoming Finn module Hakkaa Päälle!
     Matt Shostak provides a detailed scenario analysis of scenario J74 Priests on the Line
     David Olie shows you what you can do at setup with all that cool stuff you get on your scenario card in A Place For Your Stuff.
     Jim Stahler gives us a detailed breakdown of the scenarios in Turning The Tide.
     Ian Daglish provides designer's notes on the conception and birth of Action Pack 4: Normandy 1944.
     Bret Hildebran and J.R. Tracy take us on a detailed look at their defensive setups for scenario J113 Maczek Fire Brigade


And there are 16 ASL scenarios:

J113 Maczek Fire Brigade (Novy Targ, Poland, 4 September 1939); Germans vs. Polish
J114 The Marketplace at Wormhoudt (Wormhoudt, France, 28 May 1940); Germans vs. British
J115 Last Push to Mozhaisk (Mozhaisk, Russia, 17 October 1941); Germans vs. Russians
J116 Brigade Hill (Efogi, Papua, 8 September 1942); Japanese vs. Australian
J117 The Triangle (Buna Mission, Papua, 21 November 1942); Japanese vs. Americans
J118 Elephants Unleashed (Ponyri, Russia, 5 July 1943); Germans vs. Russians
J119 Sovkhoz Haystacks (Telman Sovkhoz, Crimea, 28 January 1944); Germans vs Russians
J120 Ishun Tank Traps (Ishun, Crimea, 11 April 1944); Germans vs. Russians
J121 Schloss Hemingstein (Brandscheid, Germany, 14 September 1944); Germans vs. Americans
J122 Bloody Bois Jacques (Bastogne, Belgium, 22 December 1944); Germans vs. Americans
J123 Charging Chaumont (Chaumont, Belgium, 23 December 1944); Germans vs. Americans
J124 The Cobra Kings (Assenois, Belgium, 25 December 1944); Germans vs. Americans
J125 Everything is Lost (Berlin, Germany, 30 April 1945); Germans vs. Russians
VotG 19 Cellar Dwellars (Central Stalingrad, 17 September 1942); Germans vs. Russians
VotG 20 Terror at Twilight (Central Stalingrad, 18 September 1942); Germans vs. Russians
VotG 21 Defending the Voentorg (Central Stalingrad, 22 September 1942); Germans vs. Russians

Name: Crystal Core: Battle for Nih'ki
Description:
From the designer's website:

Crystal Core: Battle for Nih'ki is a tactical wargame for two to four players.

Players battle for control of various objective zones, using one of four factions: the Daiseep, Humans, Khelons, and Saahrai. Each force is commanded by one or two Heroes, and features a number of Troopers and/or Vehicles. In the advanced game mode, players can select armoury cards to provide their units or their whole force with unique abilities.

Crystal Core features simulated parallel play through the use of command cards, which are selected simultaneously by each player, and define what actions are available for that round. Players must devise a plan for each round, and execute it with a focus on army-cohesion and maneuvering for prime position to achieve victory.

The game also provides a superior wargaming experience by eliminating several of the upkeep actions associated with wargames, including model-per-model movement, excessive dice rolls, and army wide actions, thereby providing maximum entertainment in a modest timeframe.
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: Trivia in a Trunk: Action Movie Trivia Game
Description:
From the back of the box: "The ultimate trivia fan's stocking stuffer. Everything from your favorite carols to holiday movies, tradition and history. A game for the whole family to play during the Ho-Ho-Holidays!"

Comes with 200 cards, each has three questions (one in each of the following categories: Trees, Candles, Bells. Hint the category names are not too intuitive. For instance "Candles" focuses on Holiday Movies & TV Specials.

An additional twist has a "Take 2" on some questions meaning that in order to score points you have to answer both parts correctly.
Families: Series: Trivia in a Trunk (Movie Game Inc)

Name: Consensus Music Edition
Description:
Description from BoardgameNews

Consensus Music Edition uses the same game play as the other Consensus titles released by Mindlogic: Ten things are laid out on the gameboard – song titles in this case of this game – then players are presented with a category, such as "Song most likely to be on Bill Clinton's iPod," and secretly choose one thing that they think best represents the category. If you match someone else's answer, you scoot ahead on the path to victory. All things chosen by a player, whether matched or not, are removed from the gameboard and replaced with new cards. The first player to reach the end of the path wins.

Name: Principality:  A Choir of Angels
Description:
Publisher's website:

In Principality, players lead the angelic Hosts of heaven in an exciting and challenging battle against the dark Deceivers and their fiendish minions.

Now, the Choir of Angels expansion set presents a host of all-new heavenly protectors to add to your Principality base set.  Introducing Emerald and Pearl Angels and archangels to reinforce the original Blue and Gold host.  A Choir of Angels also presents a slippery new Deceiver and its two twisted minions!

Just as in the Principality base set, the angelic hosts of heaven battle demons called deceivers. Players play as team of angels – gold, blue, pearl, and emerald. (the addition of two new color teams of angels expands this game to 4 player) The first player to capture 3 of the 5 Deceiver cards wins the game.

Name: Tales of Titans
Description:
Adventure fantasy board game system.

Welcome to world where each intelligent race worship titans as gods. Brave Humans, Dare Trolls, Furious Orcs still at war with Deceitful Centaurs, Little Kobolds digging earth and Noble Werecats. All of them will face threat of Dark Titan cult.

First scenario: Trials
In first scenario players will be able to lead four different characters: the chosen ones: Human swordsman, Human wizard apprentice, Troll hunter and Troll shaman, to complete series of tasks to please their Titan.

Highlights:
- modular board (each game can be different)
- game system with open world allowing easy prepare new scenarios, new encounters, new rewards 
- brand new fight system
- competition play with cooperation elements
- best ideas from WoW:TBG, WoW:TAG, Runebound and Descent:RTL  in one with some unseen solutions.
- different in gamefactions and reputation system
- different style of play for each character (swordsman with combo points, shaman with totems)

More information on blog:
http://bri-gryplanszowe.blogspot.com/

Name: Warzone: Dawn of War
Description:
User Summary:
The first official supplement for Warzone which includes new heroes and villains from the Mutant Chronicles universe, as well as revised close combat rules, new weapons/equipment, units, and rules for specialized forces (AI, Necrotechnology, etc).

From the back of the book:
Warzone
Dawn of War
In Nomine Cardinalis
The solar system is a roaring mayhem of death and war. The surfaces of the inner planets have been swept clean by the violent onslaught of the Dark Legion's storming hordes of Nepharites, Necromutants, Razides, Pretorian Stalkers and Undead Legionnaires. The human corporations have offered fierce resistance, but divided they fall...

Name: ASL: Journal – Issue One
Description:
The premiere issue of the ASL Journal was released in 1999.

(This description of the magazine comes from the publisher.)

The Table of Contents for ASL Journal #1 looks like this:


     Hello From MMP


      Where We're at and Where We're Going

     Smoke Gets In Your Eyes


      All You Wanted to Know About SMOKE

     What To Do If You Have a Tin Can


      Bad Tanks Aren't All That Bad

     RB CG IV - Bled White


      A New CG for the Greatest HASL Module Ever

     Series Replay - Scouts Out


      Scenario A109 - Scout's Out

     Chapter S - Historical Solitaire ASL


      RB HASL SASL

     Personal Tens


      My Favorite Scenarios

     Welcome to the Jungle


      Tactical Tips for Playing the Japanese

     Run Through the Jungle


Programmed Instruction for the PTO

Rules: 
Includes rule pages S23-S25 (with 99 superscript) for solitaire ASL.

Scenarios:
J1 Urban Guerillas
J2 Battlin' Buckeyes
J3 A Sunday Stroll
J4 Wet Sawahs
J5 Bizory Loves Company
J6 St. Barthelemy Bash
J7 Slow and Steady
J8 Block Busting in Bokruisk
J9 A Stiff Fight
J10 Armored Fist
J11 In the Old Tradition
J12 Jungle Fighters
SASL Mission r1 Assault on the Assembly Hall
SASL Mission r2 Breakout!
SASL Mission r3 Hold the Factory
SASL Mission r4 Assault on Red Barricades

Name: Isla Tetra
Description:
(now available as Isla Tetra 2 - please check BGG page)

The first game from Will Sargent's Solway Games uses a colourful new puzzle system to create essential inventory items which can be used to explore the mysterious island, ISLA TETRA.

The same colourful grids are built to earn Exploration, Health and Fishing actions, making for a puzzling castaway adventure of the like never seen before.

You might think you can get by simply walking the sun-kissed sands, soaking up the sun, but leave your island escape plan too late and you'll find events back home have taken a turn for the worse: As the months tick by, the search for your crashed plane is eventually called off, your job is readvertised, and your car has been sold to keep up with the bills. After two years of waiting, your family holds a memorial service and your partner is now returning to a social life as a single person. You might be a great survivor, but at what cost?

Each turn players can beachcomb for useful items such as rope, old bits of wire and driftwood. You might even find a pilot's hat or laminated crash instructions washed up from the azure, salty brine. These pieces of flotsam and jetsam are shown on 52 professionally printed cards and represented by brightly coloured, chunky 3D shapes which can be linked neatly together on your individual player mat to build items essential for survival.

Players must strike a balance between plundering the island’s resources for points while ensuring they’re not last off the island. Finish too low down on the time-track and you'll accrue penalty points which could rob you of victory.

It's all about strategy, and fun puzzle solving. Some of your inventory items can only be built using a single colour, while others allow two or all three. Also, some grids are larger than others, taking longer to build, some are small and awkward to fit all the available shapes into.

Upgrades can give you more playing power, such as extra card swaps and extra jokers; longer explore moves; greater fish catches. Which to go for first? It's up to you to try the many different combinations.

To start, you are only allowed to build two items at a time so think carefully... whittle away by the fire at base camp, or set out deep into the island in search of vines and timber to help strengthen your small raft, ready for the final ordeal across raging seas...

source: from publisher: Solway Games

Name: Letter-Word-Picture
Description:
Letter-Word-Picture is a fun and competitive game for boys, girls and the whole family.  In this game you learn many things! It is a means for developing language skills. The child learns new words with the help of the pictures. By matching pictures to words, the child develops verbal expression, enriches his/her vocabulary and concepts, differentiates between words and becomes familiar with the letters of the alphabet. By placing letters in the correct order to match pictures, the child learns to spell words correctly. 
Aims: 1. To learn the letters of the alphabet. 2. To put letters together to make words. 3. To match words to pictures.
From the back of the box.

Name: Progressive Mancala
Description:
Progressive Mancala was invented by Ralf Gering on September 3, 2004, in Bad Breisig, Germany. The game uses a rule which reminds of Progressive Chess.

The game was implemented for online play at games.wtanaka.com on January 28, 2010.

Rules

Progressive Mancala is played on a one-rank mancala board which numbers eleven holes. Initially there are five stones in each hole. There is also a common goal which is adjacent to the central hole of the board. Both players sit on the same side of the board in front of it. One player is called West, the other East.

East starts to the game and plays from right to left. West sows from left to right.

On each turn a player empties a hole and then distributes its contents into the following holes, one by one, in his direction. If he reaches the end of the board, he continues to distribute the stones by first dropping a stone into the Goal, then into the holes starting from the opposite end of the board. That is, he circles around the board.

If the last stone is dropped into a non-empty hole, its contents (including the last distributed stone) are picked up and then distributed as usual in multi-lap games.

The move ends if the last stone is dropped into an empty hole or the goal.

For each move that a player has terminated in an empty hole, his enemy must make a bonus move (bonus moves are compulsory).

If the last stone is dropped into the goal, the player captures its contents including the last distributed stone. The captured stones are stored. Dropping the last stone into the goal never results in a bonus move for the opponent.

The player who captured most stones is declared the winner. Draws are impossible because the sum of all stones is odd.

Expert Variant

Good players may take a board which has 17 holes. Again, there are five stones in each hole at the start of the game.

Name: WO Bonus Pack: ASL Scenario Bonus Pack for Winter Offensive 2010
Description:
(from user's description:)

A limited print run of 1000 copies to benefit the ALS Association in the fight against ALS (more commonly known as Lou Gehrig's Disease)

Consists of ASL map board 59 and two scenarios, Failure to Communicate and French Toast and Bacon.

Name: Powerhouse
Description:
In Powerhouse each player is the head of a crime syndicate that's yearning to take control of The City. To gain influence you'll need to infiltrate various authority powerhouses with your Minions. He who controls the powerhouses will dominate and be the one and only real authority in The City!

Powerhouse is an area control boardgame where players take turns to move one of their Minions to a certain place in The City. When you have the mayority in key locations (powerhouses), new powers will be unlocked for you to use. Players will feel like mafia crime lords that try to bribe, talk and fight their way to the top, using only their followers.

The first edition is a free print and play version.

Name: Tyrant's Lair
Description:
Tyrant’s Lair: The Battle of Berlin: April 1945 / Berlin: Führer’s Bunker / Berlin: Führer’s End / Berlin II is a detailed Historical Module for owners of BEYOND VALOR covering part of the battle for Berlin in 1945.

The street-level map at 50-yards scale.
2 Maps cover the Führer's Bunker area.

Can be combined with Berlin: Fall of the 3rd Reich.

Name: Rikado
Description:
From the instructions:

"Dexterity and concentration game with chopsticks and Rikado grains for children and grown-ups."

"Objective of the game: Who can handle the chopsticks skillfully and gain most of the Rikado grains and score most points?"

Players use chopsticks to pick up a wooden Rikado rice grain and move it to their area.  If they drop it or move other rice grains, their turn ends.

Components include:  oblong wooden "rice grains": 19 natural wooden color, 12 red, 5 black, 2 violet, 1 silver; 4 pairs of chopsticks, 1 felt base, 1 long cord, 4 short cords

This is a German game, but the rules are translated into English, French, and Dutch.

Name: Nay-Jay!
Description:
Nay-Jay is a super-fast card game with simultaneous group play. Each player begins the game with their own deck from which they deal themselves a down-pile and four draw cards. They hold onto the rest of the deck to flip over one at a time in order to find more cards to play.

Cards are played in the common area on piles that are started with a "1". These card piles can be built up or down on with cards of the same color. Wild cards can be played on a pile to change its top number, color, or both. The first player to use all of the cards from their down-pile shouts "NAY-JAY!" and the round ends. The game lasts 6 rounds, and at the end the player with the highest score wins.

- designer summary.

Name: Panzer Grenadier: Winter Wonderland
Description: 4 Maps for Panzer Grenadier: Elsenborn Ridge, snow-covered art to match the season, created by artist Guy Riessen

Name: Szare Szeregi
Description:
Szare Szeregi (Grey Ranks) is a card game about the Warsaw Uprising of 1944.

The board depicts 12 regions of Warsaw and players launch multiple attack on the different regions with cards from hand that represent various unit that took part in the conflict.  The attacker can field multiple units from hand while the defender can call for support from neighbouring provinces, and the high value wins. When both players' decks run out the winner is the player with more valuable units in the regions he controls.

Name: Chez Cthulhu: Cthulhu Mask Promo Card
Description:
This promo card is available in multiple ways including, during Steve Jackson Games demo sessions, product orders, and some store locations.

Text:
You may either gain 2 Madness, or give 1 point of your own Madness to someone else, when you acquire the Cthulhu Mask.

"Guess who!"

Name: Battle of Racławice 1794
Description:
The game "RacÅ‚awice 1794" presents one of the most famous victories in the history of Poland. Players can enter into the role of both the commanders, as well as ordinary soldiers. The rules reflect fundamental aspects of the XVIII century battlefield, with the dominant linear formation. Gameplay is divided into 15 rounds.

The scale of the game is as follows. Infantry is represented as company, cavalry as squadrons. One hex is 100 meters of land. One phase corresponds to 10 minutes.

Name: Corunea RCG Adventure pack #1: Noloc Shulius & Makual
Description:
A deck of 61 cards featuring 3 adventures to play with 2 to 4 players:

     The Searing Valley
     The Emerald Embassy
     The Necropolis of Makual


Each adventure comes with a scenario describing the starting situation, the forces involved and the amount of equipment each player can allow to his character. Depending on its length, each adventure has a different number of site and non-player character (NPC) cards that are placed face down on the table and drawn when the players execute the explore action. 
The NPC can be neutral, follower or adversary, and can also change behavior depending on the allegiance of the player character that is in the same site.

The adventures add a layer of strategy and depth to the game for players already familiar with the base game.

Name: Javaé
Description:
During the period of the Brazilian discovery, several indians tribes that inhabited there, possessed different cultural degrees. Many had already reached sedentarism while others still cultivated the nomadism and due to abundance of food, they didn't develop any pastoral culture. They lived mainly hunting and collecting, not having a writing system, being the oral transmission, the bases of history, but nevertheless they reached a high degree of cultural development. They possessed advanced knowledge of hygienic medicine and astronomy. They possessed a developed religious system and the society was patriarchal, based on the chief of the tribe and the warriors Council.

The Brazilian Indian, according to authors of the period, possessed enormous muscular strength, capable of carring his equivalent in weight great distances, with a high degree of physical resistance. They possessed a very developed tracking capacity, distinguishing sounds and smells of animals and people kilometers away, being capable to hide in the forest, using early camouflage technics, very advanced for the time.

The War

The indigenous wars had a kind of "permanent state in the time", simply motivated by revenge because of the arrested and devoured relatives by the enemy (anthropophagy was very common), or because of the kidnaping and possession of women of opposing tribes. There were no objective in the conquest of lands or resources, because these were abundant for all.On the deflagration of a campaign, the chief gathers with the council of the tribe to debate about the used strategy, and usually the medicine man, the spiritual leader of the tribe, like a shaman, does the forecasts of the campaign. Setting the day for the beginning of the hostilities, depending on the chief, the organization and preparations of the war, On the day of the beginning of the conflict this same chief, makes speeches to his warriors, some times for six long hours inciting them to the combat and elevating the morals.

Javaé is a wargame for 2 players, wich attempts to simulate the conflict between the Brazilian Indian tribes Ava-Canoeiro and Javae, in colonial time. The game contains 77 counters, a map, rule book and table sheet.

Name: The Gates
Description:
The Gates is an abstract strategy game for 2 or 4 players. The board features a series of circles connected by color-coded "gate" symbols. Each player has eight plastic tokens; two each of red, yellow, blue, and green. The players maneuver these tokens through patterns of adjacent circles by moving a playing piece through a "gate" of a matching color.

The object of the game is to reach the starting circles of the opponent's playing pieces. Players are allowed to enter circles containing enemy pieces of the same color but can be "trapped" by enemy pieces of a different color.

Four players can enjoy the game by working as teams.

Includes a small 11.5" x 7.5" board, 16 high quality playing pieces, a storage insert, and rules.

Name: Around The Table
Description:
This is a Bible memory game with a Christian theme.

Players move around a colorful board bearing a representation  of a table loaded with food. They draw illustrated cards which are specially designed to help the players "see" the answers to the Biblical questions. The cards use cartoon images and a "sound-alike" word system to trigger the formation of a strong memeory pattern. The first player to correctly answer eight questions and place a marker on all eight place settings on the table is the winner.

Includes the board, 8 pawns, 64 chips, cards, rules, die, and a storage insert.

The game can be enjoyed by teams in a classroom setting.

Name: Spacetrax
Description:
A quiz game with a space themed board.

Contents include:

120 Fuel Units (markers)
1 Set of Question Cards
1 Set of Mission Cards
2 Dice
6 Spacecraft (game pieces)
6 Interplanetary Passports
6 Crayons

Name: The Stock Car Racing Game
Description:
Card driven racing simulation with 8 legends of stock car racing on the front cover.

Contents:

9 Plastic Cars
Deck of "Laps" Cards
Deck of "Trouble" Cards

Name: Landfill
Description:
Simple track movement game labeled as a 'training game'.

Contents include:

4 Player Pieces
18 Technical Cards
18 People Cards
11 Briefing Cards
12 Blue Discs 
Die

Name: Metropolitan's Group Insurance game
Description: Track movement game to teach you the urgency of buying insurance!

Name: Span It
Description: Simple mountain climbing game for children.  Game board is an insert inside the box, but it is very graphically appealing.

Name: Commander
Description:
Translated from the Russian language instructions:

This is Commander, the game which imitates the military activity of the early 19th century.  Each player will be a commander, determining the strategic and tactical goals of his troops and realizing them through combat with his opponents.

This game will acquaint you with the glorious countries in the patriotic war of 1812, and with the tactics, organization and uniforms of the European armies in 1812-1814.

Before beginning, the players need to decide on their strategic goal.  For example:  defeat your opponent(s) through reducing his forces to irreplacable levels and seizing his fortified areas, depriving him of the chance to rebuild his forces; seizure or defense of the main citadel; occupying your opponent's territory, etc."

Name: War in the Age of Magic
Description:
War in the Age of Magic is a set of fantasy wargaming rules based on the "square bashing" grid system pioneered by the "Rules for the Common Man" team.  The rules are for 15mm mass battles set in "Dark Ages" mythic lands.  Rules include battle lists, victory conditions, magic, monsters and heroic combat.  Only 6 sided dice are needed.  46 pages plus 1 quick sheet.

The "square bashing" system, as it has been named, is a departure from normal miniature systems in that it imposes a seven by five square grid over the battlefield. This grid affects movement and combat - doing away with tedious millimeter measurements and allows the player to focus on maneuvering his units and rolling the dice. Squares can be either open (no impediment to movement) or closed (terrain impedes movement).

Equipment needed for the game:

     A Table (7' x 5') marked out in a 1 foot grid.
     Some pieces of terrain.
     An army for each player. Most armies will have ~22 units and 2 generals. Normally, a unit consists of 4 bases, except Character, Artillery, Chariot, Monster consist of 1 base only.
     About 15 Dice (Ordinary 6 sided dice)
     Some dead body models to represent casualties for the purpose of morale tests.
Families: Series: Rule For The Common Man (Peter Pig)

Name: Royal Chess
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Royal Chess is like playing a game of poker and chess at the same time. It makes chess more exciting and fast-paced, while keeping the challenge of planning every move. It's the perfect combination of strategy and chance.

Each game contains two decks of 50 cards and is played with any chess set. The object of Royal Chess is to capture the Royal Family (the King and Queen pieces). You pick up five chess cards and if you have the corresponding chess piece, then you can move it like regular chess. But because your opponent does not know what cards you have, they may make very risky moves and may even try to bluff you!

After you play a card, you pick up a new one and always have five cards to choose from. There are also two Jester cards (wild cards) which can be played to re-claim or move any of your pieces.

Name: Naval Wargaming. From Ancient Galleys to U-Boats
Description:
From the Back of the Book:

"From the very beginnings of maritime conflict to the present day, Naval Wargaming provides the historical background on the ships, their weapons and their tactics.  In addition, wargaming rules for each period are provided which can be used straight from the book or modified to suit individual requirements."

Contains chapters on:
-Triremes
-Ships of the line
-Dreadnoughts
-Aircraft Carriers
-U-boats

Name: 1862: The Pacific Railway Act
Description:
The year is 1862. 
Abraham Lincoln has passed the Pacific Railway Act which will connect the United States' coasts via the first Transcontinental Railroad.
You are a wry investor and a shrewd negotiator. 4 new railroad companies have amassed a large amount of capital to accomplish this task set forth by Lincoln.
These companies need businessmen like you, to negotiate land grants for them to connect the Pacific and Atlantic coasts.
This is where you come in, to help these companies expand and develop their business.

Players will invest in 4 companies by building tracks for them.
To do this, they will buy land grants (cards) in 4 colors, numbered 1 through 6, each color matching spaces on the map board.
To be valid, the land grants must be played in order of construction, of the right color and must be in ascending or descending order numerically.

Once built, the track will give a bonus to the player (from the company's own cash), one bonus to the company (from the bank), raise the company's value and the player gets a stock from the company.

At the end of each round, each company needs to pay its expenses: 1$ for each city in its network.

If a company has no more cash in its reserve, it will have to lower its company value to pay for those expenses.

Game ends when one of these 5 conditions is met:

- one company reaches 100 on the company value track
- one company has no more stock
- one company has no more tracks to build new rails
- one company reaches 10 cities in it's network
- one company connects the east and west coasts

Stock value is calculated and each player gets a payout.
Players evaluate their Bonus cards, dealt at the beginning of the game.
The player with the most money wins.

Available from the designer

Name: Light Sword
Description:
A science fiction themed dueling game, loosely related to Rapier & Dagger by the same designer. Published in White Dwarf issue #10.

Players create characters and have them fight. Could have been used as the basis of a simple combat system for an RPG, but never was. If players wanted to allow characters to gain experience, it was recommended that the system in Rapier & Dagger be used.

Name: Foundry Miniatures Compendium:  Pirates to Darkest Africa
Description: Contains miniature wargame rule sets, painting guides, and terrain building advice for:  Pirates in West Africa, The Land of El Dorado (Aztecs), Darkest Africa (including a campaign), Greeks, Roman/Barbarian Skirmishes, and Gladiator combat.  96 pages in full color.

Name: Składaki
Description:
From the back of the box (in Polish):

1320 moÅ¼liwoÅ›ci uÅ‚oÅ¼enia najdziwniejszych pojazdów!

Zanim zamienisz marzenia o niezwykÅ‚ych mechanicznych rumakach na konkretny, bardzo ekonomiczny samochód (tak, jak to czyniÄ… doroÅ›li), dajemy Ci moÅ¼liwoÅ›Ä‡ pofantazjowania!!!

DziÄ™ki ukÅ‚adance zamienisz siÄ™ w szalonego mechanika, który ma moÅ¼liwoÅ›Ä‡ uÅ‚oÅ¼enia z jej czÄ™Å›ci mnóstwa nowych kombinacji.

Na poszczególnych czÄ™Å›ciach ukÅ‚adanki znajdujÄ… siÄ™ znaki drogowe. JeÅ¼eli na wszystkich trzech czÄ™Å›ciach bÄ™dzie taki sam znak, znaczy to, Å¼e pojazd taki wymyÅ›liÅ‚ dla Ciebie projektant.

English translation:

1320 possibilities of assembling the strangest vehicle ever!

Before you fulfil your dream of a beautiful, economical car (like adults do) we give you the chance to let your fantasy free.

You can change yourself into a crazy car-designer who has the opportunity to create a new car in a thousand ways!

On the different pieces of this game there are road signs. If on all the three pieces, that you used to create your car, the signs are the same, then this particular vehicle was proposed by the game designers.

Further information:
"SkÅ‚adaki" may be used both as a puzzle and as a game. In the competitive version players take turns in which they may perform one of the following actions:

1) Drawing a piece of a vehicle (they are all turned upside down at the beginning). The piece may be added to the reserve or used to build a vehicle at once. 
2) Exchanging two own, unused pieces from the reserve with one chosen piece from the reserve the other player. The chosen piece must share the road sign symbol with one of the pieces previously owned. The acquired piece is placed in the player's reserve who may choose at this point to use it to build a new vehicle with it.

The game ends when all the pieces have been drawn. Both players have a final possibility of building ONE final vehicle and the scoring takes place.

Each vehicle is worth 1 point. If the vehicle is composed of three pieces with the same road sign on them, then such a vehicle is worth 2 points. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Usuthu! The Battle Of Rorke's Drift 1879
Description:
Tactical level simulation for 2 players of the famous action which took place during the Zulu War of 1879. 
One player will take control of the British garrison defending the mission whilst the second player is the Zulu Induna seeking to to overrun the station whilst his warriors are still fresh, to gain a quick easy victory to make up for his impi missing out at Isandlwana

Name: La Vuelta al Mundo en 80 Días
Description:
"La Vuelta al Mundo en 80 Días" is a game where the different players should try to make a travel around the world in the lowest possible time. Starting from London, the players should administer money and overcome the differents troubles they were involved. The smartest and luckiest player will reach London on the first position and would be the winner of the game. (From the back of the box).

Spanish:

"La Vuelta al Mundo en 80 Días" es un juego en el que los distintos jugadores deben intentar dar la vuelta al mundo en el menor tiempo posible. Partiendo de Londres, tendrán que administrar su dinero y superar las distintas incidencias que les irán surgiendo, además de los imprevistos que les pondrán los otros jugadores. Ganará la partida, y llegará primero a Londres, el jugador que sea más inteligente y tenga más suerte.

Componentes:

- Un tablero de 64x80 cm, que representa la ruta a seguir en la vuelta al mundo, con seis diferentes zonas de ampliación
- Seis peanas de plástico
- Tres fichas para marcar los turnos
- Dos dados
- Noventa cartas, de los siguientes tipos:
  - De "Incidencia", que son distintas en cada zona de ampliación
  - De "Equipaje"
  - De "Transporte"
  - De "Crédito"
  - De "Imprevistos"
  - De "Última Oportunidad"
- Una plantilla con la tabla de precios
- Billetes de diferentes valores
- Una cubeta de plástico
- Un libro de instrucciones

Name: The Game of Marriage
Description:
An after dinner game for the pleasure of 4 players, based on the world of Jane Austen.
 Players spin a teetotum (top) and move their tokens around a circular track, trying to land on 4 spaces to collect the attributes needed for marriage in Austen's day: Education, Wealth, Breeding and Beauty. After collecting these, players race to land in the center where they can be declared the winner.
 The spin mechanic is varied by having 1st the player & then the left-hand neighbor spin; the player has a choice of 4 different methods of calculating their move between these two spins: Adding them together, Subtracting the lower from the higher, Taking only the Lower or the Higher.
 Published in the 1990's; packaged in a cylindrical box, with a small folding board, separate rules in English and French, attractive wooden tokens for the 4 attributes, 1 wooden teetotum/spinner and 4 small wooden horseshoes for player tokens, with the small pieces in a small cloth drawstring bag.
(User Summary from actual Game, no designer or year available in game.)

Name: Revolution! The Palace
Description:
Included in the expansion : 

6 New Bid Boards with 4 new Influential People to choose.
1 Palace Building Board
2 New Player Colors (Orange & Purple) and Screens

 4 New Influential People and Abilities: 

Viceroy  - Influence Palace/Occupy Guardhouse
Messenger  - Three Support/Move two of your cubes to any two empty spaces.
Mayor  - Influence any open Influence Space.
Constable  - Five Support/1 Blackmail

New Palace Building 
The Palace Building tile is placed over the park space on the original board and is worth 55 support.  It has 9 empty spaces for influence tokens, 1 being in a separate area on the tile called the Guardhouse.  Any player who has an influence cube in the guardhouse is protected from having any of their influence cubes moved on the board.

Name: Small's Round Australia Motor Contest
Description: This game circa 1925 is an advertizing game and comes from the Small's Chocolate Company. The ad on the box states that "Small's make Club, Family and Jersey Milk Chocolate" and another states that "Small's make great chocolates". The object of this game was to motor around Australia, buying and eating chocolate all the way by rolling dice.

Name: Bomber: The Big Power Game
Description:
Bomber The Big Power Game  is a Game of Board Warfare.

The object of the game is to destroy by bombing all bases that have been acquired by your ppponents or by destroying all of their aircraft.

You win the game by being the sole survivor in the game, by holding any base or aircraft.

The game combines elements of luck and skill.

Conducting diplomacy between players while trying to develop alliances through pacts with other players and the trading of both Credential Cards of Title and equipment is what will lead you to  tactical advantages over your opponents which will eventually lead you to victory

Game Contents
Game Board.
Briefing Cards - Bombers/Fighter Bomber's.
Pack of Title Cards.
Set of Pact Cards.
4 Sets of Playing Counter's.
Arms Factory Tokens.
Oil Refinery Tokens.
Army Dump Tokens.
Oil Dump Tokens.
2 Dice.

Name: Sword & Scepter
Description:
A strategic fantasy adventure of quests and treasures, battles and diplomacy. Be the first to establish your domain by reuniting the realms of man and beast.

The map is randomly generated using 25 tiles which contain various terrains (or domains): mountains, forests, deserts and seas. Each player receives one pawn (gold, silver, black or white in color). All pawns begin the adventure at the village.

The village is surrounded by 4 ancient ruins which contain various treasures (again randomly generated by shuffling and arranging Treasure Cards at the beginning of the game.

Each player must land on an "undiscovered" ruin for their first turn. A player is assigned one of the 4 domains listed above based upon the ruin they discover on this turn.

The other 20 tiles on the map are called realms. They are controlled by colonies of mythical men and beasts. Each player's domain consists of 5 realms.

A player must scout each of these realms to receive quests for specific treasures (these, too, are randomly generated by arranging cards at the start of the game). A player takes control of a realm by completing its quest. The first player to control all 5 realms in their domain wins the game.

Game play is enhanced by the fact that each treasure has a power that a player may use to their own advantage for as long as they possess it. Players may also trade with and battle each other for the treasures they need to complete their quests.

Name: Thief of the Sacred Fire
Description: A Stonehenge solitaire Puzzle game. The player tries to enter the innermost circle of Stonehenge to steal the sacred fire of the ritual that stands on one of the trilithons, but it is guarded by four druids on the inner ring plus the High Druid in the bluestone track. Movement is performed based on a number of points corresponding to the color of the card drawn.

Name: Pilus
Description:
Pilus is a tile-laying game, with each tile being made of four colored squares. One tile is placed on the board at the start of the game, and each player has a hand of three tiles.

On a turn, a player lays one tile, either on the bottom level touching at least one tile already in place or on the second (or higher) level as long as at least three squares are supported by tiles underneath and certain color restrictions are met. The player can then place or move his pawn onto this tile; a player can neither cover an opponent's pawn nor score for expanding the region where an opponent's pawn is located. After playing a tile, the player scores points equal to the size of the regions created or expanded (two squares minimum), with the area being multiplied by the height of the tile.

Once all tiles have been played, the player with the most points wins.

Awards:

Winner of the NESTORGAMES continuous abstract game design contest

Name: Chek-ro
Description:
Rules excerpt:

OBJECT OF GAME
There are two distinct and different ways to win the game. The first is by getting five of your tokens in a row consecutively. Second way is by capturing ten of your opponent's tokens.

RULES FOR PLAY
One player selects all the tokens of one color. The second player takes all the tokens of the other color. Players choose for first play. The starting player places a token on one of the four circles reading, START. Tokens are not moved from spaces once they are placed on board. Play then alternates between players who then place tokens anywhere on the board. (However, to work out successful patterns of play, do not place your tokens too wide apart. By concentrating your tokens in definite areas, you will be better able to fulfill the objective of the game–5 tokens in a row.) Your 5 tokens must be placed consecutively in a vertical, horizontal or diagonal row. If you succeed in accomplishing this, you are declared the winner. The other method of winning is to capture ten of your opponent's men. A capture is performed by surrounding two of your opponent's tokens by placing two of your tokens one on each side of his. If a player places his tokens in a position so as to become out-flanked, he loses the out-flanked pair of tokens to his opponent. When a capture is completed, the captured tokens are removed from the playing field and placed in the "CAPTURED OPPONENTS" area of board. In this way, both you and your opponent can readily see how the game is progressing. Five pairs (10) of captured opponents constitute a win. Included in the set are more tokens than are necessary to complete the game. However, it is possible that a game could be played out without anyone winning. In this case, the game ends in a draw.

Chek-ro is similar to ninuki-renju and Pente

Name: H-ring spel
Description:
The object of the game is to strike 15 (either red or green coloured) rings into two of the four pockets by using a 26 inch cue. The cue is used to aim a large black ring at the coloured rings.

In the two player version each player has to eliminate one colour from the board into pockets of the same colour as the rings. The four player version is a two-team game. Players take turns in cueing. The player or team to succeed first in removing their rings from the board wins.
The goal in the single-player version is to remove the rings from the board in as few turns as possible.

There is a certain similarity between the H-ring Spel, American Carrom and Korona.

Name: We Shall Fight on the Marne: A Simulation of the First Battle of the Marne, 1914
Description:
We Shall Fight on the Marne (PnP) is an operational level simulation of the battle of the First Marne, 1914. Having invaded Belgium and north eastern France, the German army had reached within 30 miles of Paris. With victory seemingly near, the German First Army was instructed to encircle Paris from the east. Thus began the battle of the First Marne.

Can the Germans end the war quickly? Or will the Allies push them back? Game features include destroying bridges and building pontoons bridges, cavalry screening and breaking corps units into divisions.

Name: Storm
Description:
Storm is a 2 player game played on a hexagonal board.
On each turn,the player moves a friendly stack.
To move a stack,you take the whole stack.The bottom piece is put on an adjacent cell,the second bottom piece on an adjacent cell to this cell and so on.
If it is a player´s turn and he cannot make a legal move,he wins.

Name: Pirate's Quest Game
Description:
From box description:

This could be the end for Jack Sparrow and his pirate crew as they make the journey to World's End and prepare for the battle of their lives. Featuring your favourite characters, including Captain Jack Sparrow, Will Turner, Elizabeth Swann and Captain Barbossa, you'll sail the seven seas as you collect the pieces of your puzzle. Be the first to complete your character's scene and you'll be the triumphant winner, sending your opponents down to Davy Jones' Locker!

A basic roll and move round 3 multi-space rings in an endeavour to collect all 9 parts of a puzzle and complete the picture of your character. The spaces are simple instructions to collect, roll again, move on etc. Collect 3 pieces of your puzzle per track and then move to the next track when landing on the appropriate space. The winner is the first to complete his puzzle by collecting all 9 necessary pieces.
A lot of the fun for youngsters will be playing their actual characters from the films and being able to build the character's picture puzzle during the game.

Name: ASL Annual '89
Description:
The first issue of Avalon Hill's magazine/supplement for ASL, containing articles and scenarios. The ASL Journal series from MMP is the same concept, but is not tied to a yearly schedule. Early issues (such as this one) contained Squad Leader scenarios and content as well as ASL fare.

From the Table of Contents:
A Nation of Workers by Craig F. Posey
A Question of Balance by H. Sylvester & E. Murrell
The Evolution of Small Unit Tactics by John Hill
Piper's Lament by Eugene Murrell
Gunned-Up in the Desert by Mark C. Nixon
Man and Superman by Craig F. Posey
Comprehensive Index by Jon Mishcon
How to Win an ASL Tournament by Jon Mishcon
One-Half FP by Jay Kaufman
Updating the Oldies by Jim Stahler
Another Shell in the Tube by Robert Medrow

ASL Scenarios:
A1 Tavronitis Bridge
A2 Bofors Bashing
A3 Decent into Hell
A4 Beyond the Blue Beach
A5 Holding the Rear
A6 The Price of Impatience
A7 Slamming of the Door
A8 The Agony of Doom
A9 Midnight Massacre
A10 The Borders are Burning
A11 Silent Death
A12 Savoia!
DA1 L'Ecole Normale
DA2 Last Act in Lorraine
DA3 Back to School

SL Scenarios:
A1 On the Borderline
A2 Sbeitla Probe
A3 Regalbuto Ridge

Name: The International Horse Race
Description:
From the box...

"2 Great Games in One"

2 Action Packed Magnetic Board Games - The International Steeple Chase & The International Stakes Race.

Playing the Games:

The Dice - The six dice used in this game will control the speed of the horses as they move around the track.  The Luck of each jockey every time they roll the dice controls their horses chance to win.

The Track - Every space on the track that a horse can land on during the race will help or hinder their jockey in the battle to win.

The Jockey - You are the jockey that brings your horse home a winner.  You've beaten all the obstacles and the other jockeys.  You belong in the Winner's Circle...

Game Equipment:
Magnetic race tracks
Flat track & Steeple chase
6 - magnetic race horses
6 - horse identity color cards
6 - game dice
1 - dice tray
1 - instruction booklet

Name: Game of Iowa: Trivia Debate
Description: A roll-and-move trivia game with questions about Iowa

Name: The Barbarian
Description:
An introductory fantasy board game published in White Dwarf issue #15 (reprinted in The Best of White Dwarf Articles (Volume I)).

One player controls a single barbarian ("Vaarn") searching the "outlands" for the shield and sword of the "Old Fathers" while the other player controls various creatures in attempt to thwart Vaarn.

Vaarn wins as soon as he exits either side of the map with the sword and shield. Any other results is a victory for the other player.

Name: Transigo
Description: Transigo is a card driven abstract racing game for 2-6 players. Each player has 2 of the 8 colored pieces and the players try to keep it secret which pieces they have. The goal is to get the pieces through the track and obtain the best combined position for the two pieces. Each turn a player plays a movement card. All cards contain the colors of two pieces that are both moved. Subsequently, each turn, the player also repositions his/her block piece.

Name: Knapp Electric Questioner
Description:
(Info  from Ebayer deedavermont)  One of the first electric quiz games (circa 1920), the Knapp Electric Questioner had various sets of quiz cards ranging from flags to animals to trivia. 
Upon completing the circuit by touching the two probes to the correct question and answer a buzzer would sound. 
The game also included a Morse code key with the code printed on the inside lid for your convenience.

Name: Let's Get Dressed
Description: This is an easy race game for 2 to 4 players ages 5 to 9. Spin the simple spinner and then move the number of spaces to the finish line.

Name: Fractions are Fun
Description: Spin the spinner and find the fraction pieces to complete your pie. (Similar to Fun with Pizza Fractions by Learning Resources). This game is different in how you play the game which is meant for players from the 2nd to the 7th grade.

Name: ASL Annual '90
Description:
The second annual magazine/supplement for ASL, containing articles and scenarios. Early issues (such as this one) contained Squad Leader scenarios and content as well as ASL fare.



(from the Table of Contents:)Eight Million Bayonets by Craig F. Posey
Eight Steps to ASL by Jim Stahler
The Devil's Brigade by Steven Swann
Series Replay by Mark Nixon, Bill and Dave Sisler
Giving it Your Best Shot by Ron Shirtz
War in the Shadows by Charles Markuss
A Dog's Live by Rex A. Martin
How to Enjoy and ASL Tournament by Mark Nixon

ASL Scenarios:
A13 Able at Cesaro
A14 Monastery Hill
A15 Stand Fast the Guards
A16 On the Borderline
A17 The Penetration of Rostov
A18 Sbeitla Probe
A19 Cat and Mouse
A20 Counterattack at Sidi Bou Zid
A21 Counterattack on the Vistula
A22 The Crux of Calais
A23 Contest in the Clouds
A24 Regalbuto Ridge
A25 Cold Crocodiles
DA4 The Island
DA5 Intimate War
DA6 Breakout

SL Scenarios:
A4 King's Castle
A5 The Professionals
A6 A Meeting of Patrols
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Klovn Spillet
Description: Trivia game based on the danish comedy series "Klovn". Players each turn roll and move. If the square the player ends on determines if the player answer a question about the show or takes a special action like re-rolling.

Name: MMA Master
Description:
MMA Master is a board/card game that simulates Mixed Martial Arts in the cage.  The game is designed to be easy-to-learn and quick to play. MMA Master is a 2 player game for ages 12 and up.
 The game allows players to'design' their own fighter using cards depicting a wide variety of moves, strikes, grappling, and character traits.  The cards are compared and a die is rolled to indicate the various outcomes.  Damage, KO's, or submissions are recorded to determine the winner over a number of rounds.

Four expansions allow the players to add new moves from a variety of mixed martial arts to further 'specialize' their fighter in the players favorite style of cage combat.

(Publisher/Designer summary)

Name: Twisty Passages
Description:
You’re lost in a maze of twisty passages, all alike. Escape in this unusual card-and-dice game for two to four bewildered explorers.

Story
You, and at least one other person like you, have been dumped into a maze of twisty passages. The first person to find the exit is the only one who will be allowed to leave. The maze may be filled with interesting things to see, but you don’t want to make it your home.

Goal
As you explore the maze, you’ll accumulate cards. These cards represent your progress toward the maze’s exit. The first person to accumulate a set number of cards is the first to the exit and wins the game.

(Source: Publisher's Website)

Name: Grid Race
Description:
Welcome to the race tracks. Being a race car driver is not a simple task, especially in this twisted track with spilled oil over it. Can you control your car and maneuver it to the victory?
The track is constructed from 6 up to 12 map sections with transparent slides covering some of the sections to show oil spills.
The players move their car with simple acceleration and deceleration rules with no randomness. While setting the car movement speed is simple, going through the track without going into the walls, or being blocked by other cars is not so simple especially when 5-6 cars or on the same track.
Some of the tracks are narrow which makes the track even harder and can be used when the players are more experienced.

Reimplements:

     Racetrack

Name: Ten Sports Games To Play With Dice
Description:
From the "Letter from the author" page:
"The games included in this 'Ten Sports Games To Play With Dice' have been developed and played by my family and friends for over 20 years.  Foregoing the more traditional board games which sell for five and ten dollars and more, we would take our pencil and paper and a pair of dice and develop a game of our own.  This way, we could make the game suit whatever mood we were in.  Being avid sports fans like yourself, we often developed different sports games that we could use to capture the excitement of real sports.  So over the years we gradually accumulated the rules for dice games in nearly every popular sport."

Includes the following games:

     Dice Baseball
     Dice Football
     Dice Basketball by Players
     Dice Hockey
     Dice Basketball - Scholastic Quarters
     Dice Soccer
     Dice Baseball - Team Play
     Dice Basketball - Professional
     Dice Bowling
     Dice Wrestling

Name: Decipher
Description:
Decipher was an entry in the 2005 About.com Deduction Game Design Competition. It only uses a standard deck of cards and 6 tokens (pennies, gamecounters, etc.)

"Can you crack the code in time? In Decipher, you must figure out your opponent's hidden code before they figure out yours. It requires logic, deduction, and strategic cardplay."

In this game players try to crack the hidden three-card code of their opponent by playing one, two or three cards in front of the hidden code. Your opponent will show you whether your guess was correct or not. If you made a correct guess, you know that you only know half of the truth: was the suit correct or the rank of the card? That's for you to find out before you run out of cards.

Name: Read the Clock! Time Game
Description:
Publishers description:
"Students read the clock and race to stay on schedule—strengthening time-telling skills as they play! In this skill-building math game, players match clock cards to times printed on the game board…and race through a day of exciting activities. The first player to match up all of her clock pieces wins the game!"

Game Components include:
Game Board
24 clock cards
24 time word cards
Answer card
4 playing pawns
1 six sided die

Read the Clock allows players to choose from three possible games:

Game #1: Watch the Clock!
Players race to match clock cards to the times shown on the game board.

Game #2: What Time Is It?
Players race to match time word cards to the times shown on the game board.

Game#3: Time Masters
An advanced game using both time word cards and clock cards.

Name: Place Value Mystery House Game
Description:
Publishers description:
"Students search a haunted house for golden numbers—and take the mystery out of place value! In this skill-building math game, players solve place value problems to move around the game board…then check their answers in the mystery decoder and write each answer on their place value cards. The first player to reach the golden numbers wins the game!"

Game Components:
Game board
50 Mystery cards
Mystery decoder envelope
4 write & wipe place value cards
4 dry-erase markers
4 game pawns

Name: Making Cents Money Game
Description:
Publishers description:
"Students race to fill up their piggy banks—and polish their money skills as they play! In our skill-building game, players work out money problems with realistic coins…and write the answers on their piggy bank cards. The first player to fill up a piggy bank card wins the game!"

Game components:
Game board
45 plastic coins
32 game cards
4 write & wipe bank cards
4 write & wipe markers
4 Game pawns
1 six sided die

Advanced Play Variant:
Play continues until all players have filled in all 8 lines on their piggy banks cards.  Players add up their money.  The player with the most money in the bank wins.

Name: Habitat Challenge: A Life Science Game
Description:
Publishers Description:
"Who will be the first explorer to sail to the polar ice cap? It could be you…if you can answer questions about animals and their habitats correctly! In this skill-building game, students answer fascinating life science questions to move around the game board from one habitat to the next…then slip the question cards in the secret decoder to check their answers"

Game components:
Game board
50 question cards
Secret decoder
4 Game pawns
1 six sided die

Name: Synonym & Antonym Safari Adventure Vocabulary Game
Description:
Publishers description:
"Players journey deep into the jungle to hunt for synonyms and antonyms-building essential vocabulary skills as they play! To play, students draw game cards and match them to either synonyms or antonyms on the board. The first player to find a match for all of her cards wins the game!"

Game components:
Game board
48 game cards
4 Game pawns
1 spinner
Reference list of words

Players may choose from one of three possible games:

Game #1: Synonym Adventure
Players match game cards to their synonyms on the game board.

Game #2: Antonym Adventure
Players match antonym game cards to their opposite on the game board.

Game #3: Advanced Play
Players use both Antonym and Synonym cards.

Name: Prefix Pitfall Vocabulary Game
Description:
Publishers description:
"Players race to reach the safety of the temple by matching prefixes to root words—building essential vocabulary skills as they play! To play, students roll prefix dice and match them to root words on the game board…then build each new word on their write & wipe game cards. The player to build the most words wins the game!"

Game components:
Game board
4 prefix with 11 prefixes
4 write & wipe game cards
4 write & wipe markers
4 Game pawns
1 six sided die
Word list

Name: Using Context Clues: Riddle of the Ruins Vocabulary Game
Description:
Publishers description:
"Players solve the riddle of the ancient ruins by deciphering clues and defining words—building essential vocabulary skills as they play! To play, students draw game cards and use context clues to answer each question…then slip the card into the secret decoder to reveal the answer. Students roll the die and move around the game board with each correct answer…and the first player to reach the Sphinx wins the game!"

Game components:
Game board
50 context clue game cards
1 secret decoder
4 Game pawns
1 six sided die

Name: Sunken Suffixes Vocabulary Game
Description:
Publishers description:
"Players search for pirate's treasure by matching suffixes to root words—building essential vocabulary skills as they play! To play, students try to match suffixes on their game cards to root words on the board…then build each new word on their write & wipe cards. The player to build the most words wins the game!"

Game components:
Game board
45 suffix cards
4 write & wipe game cards
4 write & wipe markers
4 Game pawns
1 six sided die
Word list

Name: Perfidia
Description:
A shadow hangs over the Kingdom. Goblin armies are amassing on the horizon, and the King's Seer receives a vision that two of the his closest companions are plotting a betrayal. Will the Kingdom be able to withstand the invaders and expose the traitors, or will it fall into ruins?

Perfidia is a card game for two players. One player will play as the Kingdom, and the other is known as Traitor. The game is centered around eight characters, two of which are chosen secretly by the Traitor player. Victory requires clever card management and use of characters, as well as deductive and bluffing skills to predict the traitors!

-C. Wade McKenzie, Designer

Name: What's the Matter?: Physical Science Game
Description:
Publishers description:
"Who will be the first to find the perfect potion? It could be you…if you can correctly identify the properties of matter! In this skill-building game, students answer physical science questions to move around the game board…then slip the quiz cards in the secret decoder to check their answers."

Game components:
Game board
50 quiz cards
Secret decoder
4 Game pawns
1 six sided die

Name: Out of This World: Earth & Space Science Game
Description:
Publishers description:
"Who will be the first astronaut to reach the edge of the solar system? It could be you…if you answer questions about earth and space science correctly! In this skill-building game, students travel through the solar system by answering questions about the earth’s properties, planets, stars and more……then slip the quiz cards in the secret decoder to check their answers."

Game components:
Game board
44 question cards
20 planet challenge cards
4 Game pawns
Secret decoder
1 six sided die

Name: Fraction of the Pizza Game
Description:
Publishers description:
"Players dish up a delicious looking pizza pie—and get plenty of hands-on practice with fractions! To play our skill-building math game, students draw fraction picture cards and match them to numeric fractions on the game board. The first player to match up all of their fractions wins the game!"

Game components:
Game board
30 game cards
1 spinner
Answer card
4 Game pawns

Name: Fang den Fisch
Description:
Note from the box:

Players in turn roll the die and then simultaneously try to catch the fish shown on the die. If a wrong fish has been caught it must be back into the ring. The first player to catch 2 fish has won the game. For smaller children the die can beleft out, the game ends when all fish have been caught, the player with the most fish wins the game. If more than two are playing, everybody plays against everybody else, who wins the most duels?

Name: Gespenster-ABC
Description: Collection of games on the subject of letters and the alphabet – the material enables children to name, list and paint the numbers from 1-10 and to intensify their knowledge with several games.

Name: Märchenzeit
Description: Card game collection with well known games, the cards are decorated with fairy tale characters, the cards can be used for the following games: Zwergen-Mau-Mau, Prinzessinen-Quartett and Märchenmemo.

Name: Lilla Miljöspelet
Description:
The Little Environmental Game

Play the game and learn about how the milk affects the environment. The path from 'Start' to 'Goal' [Mål] are not numbered at the gameboard, but you actually move your counter from circle number 1 to number 78. The gameboard is illustrated with: cows, trucks, a tractor, farms, a school, a dairy, a shop and other features. At some circles an event occur, as for example at circle number 14: 'It's written 'Mikl' in stead of 'Milk' at the packages. Don't move your counter next turn and revise the typo.

The game is published by the largest producer of dairy products in Scandinavia, Arla Foods, and the  purpose with the publishing is to show how environmentally friendly the company is.

Name: Pitfalls
Description:
Pitfalls: The Magnet Maze, Hard on the Hands, Easy on the Eyes.
...Call it a Puzzle
...Call it a Game
...Call it a Sculpture
...But watch out for

Pitfalls

Here is a puzzle as handsome as it is challenging. The object is to lead a steel ball through a maze by means of a magnetic wand without letting the ball fall into the pitfalls along the way. It's a game to test your manual dexterity, concentration and coordination of eye-and-hand. Challenge your family, friends, boss and secretary to see who can get the highest score. When at rest, Pitfalls makes an handsome accent to your home or office.

Name: Terry and the Pirates
Description:
User summary...

"A Sunday Funnies Game"

Game based on the comic strip which ran from 1934-1973 with two different cartoonists.

The game itself involves moving around a block maze and picking up treasures.

Name: The Game of Shopping at the Supermarket
Description:
User Summary....

Move a shopping cart through the store in an attempt to pick up one food card from each department; the winner is the first player to collect six different cards, pass the cashier and go out.

Contents:

* spinner with instructions
    * 24 food cards (4 of each food group)
    * folding game board
    * 4 plastic shopping carts

Name: World's Greatest Trivia Game
Description:
More questions in more categories than you can imagine. Four thousand questions, many of which are True/False or Multiple Choice.

Eight fascinating categories: MOVIES, MUSIC, SPORTS, POP CULTURE, TV, LITERATURE, GEOGRAPHY, NATURE. Unique scoring system on the game board keeps track of where each player stands in the race to the finish and it’s always anybody’s game.

Family fun for age 13 and up.

from Barnesandnoble.com
